title: Font Designers-Who is YOUR favorite?
content:
Just a curious question as I am brand new to this site-

Who are some favorite font designers and what are the best fonts from each?
author: Jennie Wojtulewicz

comments.content: Way too many to list - but if my font purchasing habits are any indication then [Christian Schwartz](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105121531/http:/christianschwartz.com/) and [Neil Summerour](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105121531/http:/blog.positype.com/) are at the top of the list. I have quite a few of their faces.

As Simon says - too many to list - so just some random picks: [Kris Sowersby](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105121531/http:/klim.co.nz/) (National), [Scaglione & Burian](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105121531/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/scaglione/people/?view=list), and many of the designers at [OurType](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105121531/http:/www.ourtype.be/) including Smeijers (Ludwig and many other superb designs), Thiemich (Alto). Dan Reynolds' [Malabar](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105121531/http:/www.linotype.com/5831/malabar.html). Some of the work of [Feliciano Type Foundry](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105121531/http:/www.felicianotypefoundry.com/main/) (Merlo, Rongel, Stella). [Adrian Frutiger](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105121531/http:/www.linotype.com/793/adrianfrutigertraces.html) has done great work his entire career - more recently, new releases of classics like Univers Next and produced new designs such as Frutiger Serif. [Gerard Unger](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105121531/http:/www.gerardunger.com/) is notable (Swift).

For broader surveys see [Typographica's Favourites of 2008](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105121531/http:/typographica.org/2009/features/our-favorite-typefaces-of-2008/), and [TDC Best of 2009](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105121531/http:/tdc.org/tdc/tdc2-2009-winners) and [2008](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105121531/http:/www.tdc.org/news/2008Results/) - which gives you an idea of who's who, out there.

To me, [Christian Schwartz](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105121531/http:/christianschwartz.com/) because he consistently delivers outstanding designs, [Ludwig Übele](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105121531/http:/www.ludwiguebele.de/) because his designs are much more ineresting than most stuff designed at the moment, [Lucas de Groot](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105121531/http:/www.lucasfonts.com/) simply because he designed TheSans, and Robert Slimbach, who has given us some of the most useful types available today. And, last but not least, Adrian Frutiger, the greatest master of all.

[Fred Smeijers](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105121531/http:/www.ourtype.be/). One of the most versatile and inventive designers.  
All his fonts are supreme, for instance I love [Renard](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105121531/http:/www.teff.nl/fonts/renard/index.html) and [Arnhem](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105121531/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/designer/fred_smeijers/). And his classic Quadraat of course.

Bram de Does (lexicon), Adrian Frutiger (Frutiger), Fred Smeijers (Quadrat).  
Younger generation? Mmmhh... Nikola Djurek (Marlene).
